result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Timothy Ringelstetter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  No contact w/victim SAS (1/10/01) or females under 18 with prior approval of agent, however may have contact with female cousins under 18 with adult supervision.  Sex Offender Treatment, Registry and assessment.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Timothy Ringelstetter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Freely, voluntarily and knowingly waive preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2

Defendant Michael Timothy Ringelstetter in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Defendant Michael Timothy Ringelstetter in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court. State has complied with Chapter 950 notifications.  Court finds Defendant guilty. Atty. Covey makes statement.   Court imposes sentence.

Count 1:
WI State Prison for 6 years (3 years Initial Confinement/3 years Extended Supervision). Consecutive to any other 
DNA surcharge/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent
No contact w/SAS (1/10/01) or females under 18 with prior approval of agent and except contact with female cousins under 18 with adult supervision
SOT & SOR and assessement & treatment
$518.00 Costs & Supervision Fees
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Not Eligible for Earned Release

Count 2:  Dismissed but read in

Paperwork handed in court.

Pre-trial conference at 10-02-2015 10:30 am.
Return date at 10-15-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Michael Timothy Ringelstetter by video from LEC with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests cash bond of $2,500 w/conditions.  Atty Tsai responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $2,000.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/females under 18 years of age.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Return date scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
